article.headline: Utah State 81, Utah Valley State 70
article.story: LOGAN, Utah (AP) -- Durrall Peterson scored 26 and Jaycee Carroll added 21 points as Utah State University topped Utah Valley State 81-70 Wednesday night. Carroll scored all of his points on 3-pointers, going 7-for-9 behind the arc for the Aggies (11-5). Peterson was 8-for-14 from the field, and scored 18 from behind the 3-point line for Utah State. The Wolverines (10-6) were led in scoring by Ryan Toolson with 16 points and Matt Peterson with 14. Utah State didn't lead until Stephen DuCharme made two free throws to put the Aggies up 41-40 with about 16 minutes left in the game. The teams then tied or traded leads seven times before Carroll hit two consecutive 3-pointers to give Utah State a 64-56 lead with 6:49 to play. The Aggies shot eight free throws in the final 2:30 to seal the win. The Wolverines took a 14-7 lead to begin the game. The Aggies came with one point of the Wolverines twice, both on 3-pointers by Carroll, but still trailed 35-33 at halftime. With strong defensive pressure, UVSC blocked four shots in the first half and forced seven steals, as well as outrebounding Utah State 16-14.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
